meta.name: Comprehensive API Integration Suite with Health, Webhook, Auth & Rate Limit Monitoring

name: API Integration Testing & Monitoring MCP Server

parameters.description: Analyzes API endpoint health including response times, status codes, SSL certificates, and detects anomalies using historical data patterns.
Tests webhook delivery reliability by sending test payloads and measuring success rates, response times, and retry behavior for webhook endpoints.
Monitors API rate limits by checking rate limit headers, calculating usage percentages and burn rates, predicting time to exhaustion, and alerting on approaching limits.
Tests different authentication methods (Bearer, API key, Basic auth), validates token expiration, checks authentication response codes, and monitors auth failure patterns.
Aggregates monitoring data from other tools to create comprehensive client reports with executive summaries, performance metrics, and actionable recommendations.

parameters.content:
## üîß Available MCP Tools














**Analyze API Health**
üìã Tests endpoint response times, status codes, and overall health
üéØ Use: Check if APIs are responding normally

**Validate Webhook Reliability** 
üìã Tests webhook delivery with retry analysis
üéØ Use: Verify webhook endpoints are receiving data properly

**Monitor API Limits**
üìã Checks rate limit headers and usage percentages  
üéØ Use: Prevent rate limit exhaustion and plan usage

**Verify Authentication**
üìã Tests Bearer, API key, and Basic auth methods
üéØ Use: Ensure API credentials are working correctly

**Generate Client Report**
üìã Creates comprehensive reports with executive summaries
üéØ Use: Share API health status with stakeholders

‚úÖ **Step 1: Configure MCP Server Access**
- **MCP Server - API Monitor Entry** node: 
  - Path is pre-configured as "api-monitoring-server"
  - Set up Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE credentials for secure access
  - Generate a secure token for client connections

üìä How to Use MCP Tools

**Quick Test (Real Working URLs - Test These First!):**
These are verified testing endpoints that work immediately:

"Check the health of https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/posts/1"
‚Üí Free testing API, always returns 200 OK, no setup needed

"Test webhook delivery to https://httpbin.org/post"
‚Üí Instantly accepts POST data and shows what was received

"Monitor rate limits for https://api.github.com/rate_limit"
‚Üí Shows real rate limit headers, works without authentication

"Verify authentication with https://httpbin.org/basic-auth/test/test"
‚Üí Test credentials: username "test", password "test"

**For Your Production APIs:**
Once you've tested the tools, replace with your real endpoints:
- Your API health check: https://your-api.com/health
- Your webhook receiver: https://your-webhook.com/receive
- Your authenticated endpoints with real credentials

**Authentication Examples:**
- Bearer: {"auth_type": "bearer", "auth_token": "your_github_token"}
- API Key: {"auth_type": "apikey", "auth_token": "your_api_key"}  
- Basic: {"auth_type": "basic", "auth_token": "test:test"}

**What Each Test Does:**
‚úÖ JSONPlaceholder - Confirms API connectivity and response parsing
‚úÖ httpbin.org/post - Validates webhook delivery and payload handling  
‚úÖ GitHub rate_limit - Demonstrates real rate limit monitoring
‚úÖ httpbin basic-auth - Tests authentication validation flows

Start with these test URLs to see the tools working, then switch to your own APIs!

üõ†Ô∏è API Integration Testing & Monitoring MCP Server

This workflow creates a comprehensive MCP server that provides 5 specialized API monitoring tools accessible to external MCP clients like Claude Desktop or custom applications.

‚úÖ **Step 2: Deploy & Test Immediately**
- Activate the workflow in your n8n instance
- Copy the generated MCP server endpoint URL
- **Quick Test**: Use the test URLs in the "How to Use" note to verify everything works
- Then connect your real APIs and credentials

‚úÖ **Step 3: Connect MCP Client**
- Configure Claude Desktop or your MCP client with the server endpoint
- Add authentication token to client configuration
- Test connection to verify all 5 tools are available

‚úÖ **Step 4: Start Monitoring APIs**
- Begin with test URLs to see tools in action
- Gradually replace with your production endpoints
- Generate comprehensive reports for stakeholders
